item.title: Proof of Poincaré bendixson Theorem
item.description: Summary $2$ Consider a manifold $\mathcal{P}$ and a function $f,g \in C^{r} \left( \mathcal{P} \right)$ such that the following vector field is given as a differential equation: $$ \dot{x} = f(x,y) \\ \dot{y} = g(x,y) $$ If $\mathcal{M}$ represents an invariant set with a finite number of fixed points, then the omega limit set $\omega (p)$ of $p \in \mathcal{M}$ satisfies one of the following three conditions: (1): $\omega (p)$
